text.p: Qantas Airways Ltd said on Thursday a pre-tax profit result of A$450 million for the year to June 30, 1997 was possible.
"A$450 (million) is certainly in the realms of possibility," Qantas chairman Gary Pemberton said in regards to the 1996/97 pre-tax forecast.
Pemberton said he would expect similar revenue growth in 1996/97 to the six percent recorded in 1995/96.

Qantas, 25 percent owned by British Airways Plc, reported a 25.3 percent rise in pre-tax operating profit to A$401.4 million in the year to June 30, 1996 and a 36.7 percent rise in net profit to A$246.2 million.
Pemberton said he does not expect to see a similar improvement in the debt to equity ratio in 1996/97.
"That was a big change, I don't expect it to be around the same amount this year, but it will certainly be an improvement," Pemberton told reporters after the airline's new conference.
